sections.title: Career Summary
sections.summary: Recent graduate with a Master's degree in Geomatics, specializing in GIS, remote sensing, and spatial data analysis. Experienced in compiling, standardizing, and validating environmental datasets, including quantifying forest cover change using historical and modern imagery. Holds a B.A. in International Relations, with a strong interest in the intersection of geospatial analysis and international development and conservation. Combines analytical, cross-cultural, and communication skills to support research and policy initiatives on complex environmental issues.

items.degree: Master of Geomatics in Environmental Management (MGEM)
details: Developed skills in GIS, remote sensing, and spatial data analysis through hands-on projects to support environmental management and decision-making

items.degree: B.A. International Relations, Minor in Russian

items.institution: Druga Gimnazija, Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina

items.title: Applying Declassified Cold War Intelligence Imagery for Long-Term Forest Cover Change Analysis
details: Developed a hybrid remote sensing and GIS workflow to classify forest cover using historic panchromatic and modern multispectral imagery in the Pamir Mountains, integrating data from various sources
Applied segmentation, texture metrics, and supervised Random Forest classifiers to detect land cover types in challenging high-relief terrain
Quantified forest cover change over 45 years and produced maps and visuals to support land use analysis in conflict-affected regions

items.title: Legal Assistant
details: Managed estate files, maintained relationships with beneficiaries, and ensured accuracy in trust accounting using LEAP legal software
Drafted and reviewed contracts, agreements, and other legal documents for commercial transactions
Conducted legal research, filed annual reports, and maintained minute books for over 200 corporations

items.title: Philanthropy Volunteer
details: Supported fundraising by using internal tools for data synchronization
Managed Van Dusen’s Adopt-A-Tree program by updating garden maps
Utilized Donor Perfect CRM software to track contributions

items.title: Host and Server
details: Managed reservations and guest flow using OpenTable
Processed transactions and orders through Squirrel POS system
Coordinated with kitchen and bar staff to ensure smooth restaurant operations and excellent service

items.title: Guest Experience Representative
details: Provided customer support and resolved inquiries related to ticketing and resort information
Managed sensitive customer and sales data across platforms

items.title: Jewish Outdoor Leadership Institute Guide
details: Led backpacking and backcountry trips for high school students
Developed and taught outdoor and Jewish education curricula focused on group dynamics and community building
Responded to medical, social, and emotional challenges effectively

items.title: Geospatial Analysis Intern
details: Analyzed imagery and geospatial data to produce intelligence reports
Conducted open-source research to contextualize analytical results
Produced briefs for office leadership, translating complex findings into short, consumable products

items.title: Philanthropy Volunteer
details: Supported fundraising by using internal tools for data synchronization

items.title: Scholars in Prison Advocate & Conference Organizer
details: Led advocacy campaigns for imprisoned scholars
Coordinated an international academic freedom conference

details: Analyzed Sri Lanka’s political landscape for campaign developments
Designed graphics and social media posts for APF’s platforms
